page.title: 04Cowesfield House Pig Farm.
page.content: Cowesfield House Farm belonged to Mr.Jewell for 30 years until 12 years ago when he made a partnership with his son Colin.The farm is used for breeding pigs.When the pigs have been fattened up they are{sent,at 18 weeks {old, to the abattoir}to be killed for pork .When piglets are born they usually weigh 3_5 pounds,while the {sows weigh 400 pounds}and the{boars {about 500 pounds.}After the first 3 weeks of mothers milk the piglets go onto barley and wheat pellets which the other pigs eat as well.There are 21 boars and 580 sows.Each sow produces about 2.3 litters of 11 or 12 piglets per year.No pigs ever see a field although the whole farm covers about 10 acres.There are just never ending lines of sties,nearly all indoors. (Written by a group-9/11 yrs.children)
